intro: Clematopsis bojeri var. oligophylla, commonly known as the Bojer's Clematopsis, is a rare and striking member of the Berberidaceae family. It is characterized by its dark green, leathery leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. Native to the mountainous regions of southern China, this plant thrives in cool, moist environments with partial shade. Its unique foliage and floral structure make it a sought-after specimen in botanical gardens and specialized collections. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
